title: Exhibitions, auctions, seminars, presentations
unterschrift: Exhibition visitors at Kimoto exhibition, Kaiserslautern 2006
intro_text: Kimoto's works have also been on show on a variety of other occasions at solo and group exhibitions since 1972. Moreover Kimoto took part in public art donations auctions regularly, has taught calligraphy lessons and is occasionally seen in public tea ceremonies and Rakusho demonstrations. For an overview see the following list.

Calligraphy and Ink paintings:
body3_text:
For several years now Seiji Kimoto has been giving monthly lessons in calligraphy and ink painting to a small group of students. These include practical exercises for brush positioning and brush movement, explanations of the principles of ink painting, and free painting with brush and ink using techniques of Zen painting. Registrations to his seminars are possible. He also hosts workshops on the basics of calligraphy occasionally as side event of his exhibitions, most recently in 2013 at espace mediArt gallery Luxembourg.



Rakusho - Sounding characters:
body4_text:
Along with percussionist and bassist Rudolf P. Schaaf, Seiji Kimoto has participated in a number of improvisational musical-calligraphic stage performances since 2010, partly as a standalone program, partly as supporting program of his exhibitions.

body5_text: Occasionally Seiji Kimoto is also appearing at public tea ceremony demonstrations, partly in the context of the Japanese Garden's event program in the city of Kaiserslautern, partly as companion event of his exhibitions, most recently in the programme for his exhibition at St. John's Church Saarbrücken in 2012.
